BTW, all you numbnuts that keep telling downloaders not to leave negative comments, because it's "FREE"... Get a fucking clue. No one is complaining about the price. We all appreciate the effort. However, the comments section is specifically there to help users determine quality before spending their bandwidth. If the file I am considering downloading is poor quality, it's nice to have that info upfront. I can either look for a better version, settle for lower quality or simply not download it. You assholes who give everything a 7 or 8 rating when you know the video is borderline unwatchable, you aren't doing anyone any favors. Giving a bad rating is not a personal attack on the uploader, it's a necessary part of keeping peers informed.

@robsai: Quote, "Prometheus is probably the WORST movie I have seen in years."

I disagree, but you and myself are entitled to our own opinions.

Let me ask you this, Just curious, YES, I suppose this film can stand on its own as a story in and of itself, but to really understand what its all about you would need to have seen the 1ST ALEIN film by Ridley Scott. It hit the theaters in 1979. (about a year or so after LUCAS released the 1st STAR WARS film in 1977-78). 
My point is unless your in your mid 40's, you probably haven't seen the original ALIEN film unless your a big fan of the SCI-FI genre.
After all, ALIEN came out 33 YEARS ago, and it was Rated R. SO.... unless you were 18 years old in 1979 OR, your parents or older friends, brothers/sisters took you and you were younger then 18, then so be it. I was only 12 years old and I fell into the group of having a friend with an older sister who took us. IT was SCARRY as HELL!! I remember being traumatized for a few weeks! I saw it later when I was 19 yrs old, and it was still disturbing, but A great story/horror film.
The other aspect is that RIDLEY SCOTT was not involved in any way with the other ALIEN FILMS.
Scott had ALWAYS considered making a sequel/prequel, based on the identity of who had a cargo hold SLAM FULL of those ALIEN EGGS?? and WHY did they have a cargo hold slam full of those eggs. What purpose did they truly serve?

FYI or TWIMC (To Whom It May Concern) Another "PREQUEL" is already being shot as we speak. Its due to be released in late 2013 or early 2014. 
It continues where PROMETHEUS ended. (don't want to spoil the plot.)

My MAIN POINT is that if you haven't seen the 1st ALIEN film, A lot of what is going on in Prometheus will seem as if it has many "loose ends", and may not seem as good a movie.

In my opinion, it is a GREAT GREAT movie! ! !
I am now waiting to see the next prequel due out the end of next.

geno2k3 that comment just boggles the mind with how utterly inaccurate it is. The Star Trek movie has one of the biggest sci-fi plot holes in history and it totally removed any credibility that film (and your comment) had, the time travel bit simply doesn't work, they just didn't get it at all... It's as bad as DĂŠja Vu in terms of getting it utterly wrong. Seriously bad. Intellectual sci-fi? Star Trek was the opposite. 

Prometheus, without giving anything at all away here to people currently downloading or those who haven't seen it yet, is all about evolution. That's the main theme Ridley and the writers are going with. 

The characters are not as important as the theme behind it. Is it a prequel to Alien? Not directly but it does show you the origin of the Xenomorph, if you understand evolution. If you don't then the entire premise of this film will go over your head, as it appears to have done with most of those who dislike it.

I have not downloaded this file, so I won't talk about video and audio quality.

However, I went watch this movie in Scotia Bank Theatre (Toronto, Canada) yesterday evening (7:35PM precisely).
I payed extra and watched this one in UltraAVX (width of screen is almost as wide as IMAX but not as tall, but the sound quality is better) to enjoy the movie I have waited for years to come.
Before go on, let me tell you that the last movie I watched in theater was Avatar (James Cameron's one, not the Airbender one made by M.K.S.).
I don't go theater very often, so it was big thing for me to take round trip of 3 hours and pay extra for a movie, meaning I expected that much from this movie.

When I was watching this, things I noticed was, the 3D work was really bad.
There's part where I couldn't really tell what the hell was standing, and the face doesn't even show clearly.
The only part that 3D work seemed perfectly good was where one of the character (I won't spoil the name here) triggered navigation system.
Also, there wasn't any character development but many unnecessary acts.
More than half of the characters doesn't even seem to be needed.
Only character that lived to stand the expectation was the main female character.
Also, some of the actions characters made just doesn't make sense or will leave you with a question "why the fuck he did that?"
No answers wherever I look for it (though people have some discussion on it).

Riddley Scott put too much attention on mystic figure, Christian symbolism into this movie, he failed to grab attention of viewers, build suspense, character development.
It might even leave you with a question if this movie made any logical sense.
I watched whole Alien series in elemetary school, and waited sequel/prequel since 1999 (because video version of Alien 4/Ressurection came that year in my country).
Some people say this movie was really bad, some say it's good, but my reaction to this movie is "What the fuck did I just watch?"
Yes...it could've been better.
If Riddley is thinking to create sequal to this movie, I will probably watch it again, as Alien series fan, but I really hope he will do it right this time, cause I couldn't find anything right with this movie.
